result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jed M. Travis

records.addlTxt:
9:07 AM Defendant Jed M. Travis appeared by video, Portage County Jail in custody.  Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appeared by video for Jed M. Travis. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Lead Deputy Portage Co. Clerk of Court Office Shirley appeared by video. 
Cases 21CF176, 22CF06, and 22CF35. Court confirms there are no victims present in Court or by Zoom and that the Defendant is able to hear.
Court questions the defendant as to the waiver of the right to be present in person in court.
Court finds the defendant has knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to appear in court. 
Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
21CF176 Count 1 - No Contest
22CF35 Count 1 - No Contest

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of  21CF176 Count 1 and 22CF35 Count 1.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
21CF176 Counts 2, 3, & 4, 22CF35 Counts 2, 3, & 4, and 22CF6 are dismissed and read in.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

ADA Dodge makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Bergner concurs with the joint recommendation. 

BY THE COURT: 
21CF176 Count 1 and 22CF35 Count 1
BY THE COURT: 
Determinate sentence of 4 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 
2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision, concurrent with each other and any other sentence currently being served. 
4 days credit.
Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
*Eligible for Substance Abuse and Earned Release Programs.
* Pay restitution - no requested at this time. 60 days to submit. If not submitted then it will be zero
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment. 
*Comply with other assessments or treatments deemed appropriate by DOC or by Agent. 
*Pay costs and surcharges
Order to Produce
E-mail correspondence from Marathon County in re:  minutes and setting for upcoming plea/sentencing hearing
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Minutes from Pretrial Conference

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:23 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jed M. Travis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Jed M. Travis. 
Both files heard: 22CF6, 22CF35

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jed M. Travis appeared by video, in custody from Stanley Correctional Center.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Jed M. Travis. 

Both files heard:  22CF6 & 22CF35

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bonds continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
2:29 PM Defendant Jed M. Travis not in court.  Attorney Taylor Soule appeared on behalf of Atty Maxwell Bergner for Jed M. Travis.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF6 and 22CF35.

Defendant fails to appear.
Atty Soule states that the defendant is currently in the Marathon County Jail.
Court would ask that Atty Soule try to contact Marathon County Jail to see if he could appear via ZOOM.
Defendant still does not appear.
Court will adjourn both cases.

BY THE COURT:
Bonds are continued on both cases.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner

2:17 PM Defendant Jed M. Travis not in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF6 and 22CF35.

Court indicates that the defendant was in the Marathon County Jail last month.
ADA Mutchler makes statements.
ADA Mutchler will adjourn.
Parties are informed that the defendant is in Dodge Correctional.

BY THE COURT:
Case is adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:37 PM Defendant Jed M. Travis appeared by video from the Marathon County Jail, in custody. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Cases heard today are 22CF6 and 22CF35.

Defendant is informed that he is entitled to have counsel represent him for the criminal cases.
Defendant wishes to have an attorney.
Defendant states that he has an attorney appointed and that is Atty Bergner.
Defendant's last evaluation was done more than 90 days ago, he is informed to contact the public defender's office to complete an updated evaluation.
Defendant wishes to adjourn both cases.
State does not object to the adjournment.
Bond is set in 22CF35 by the State.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is continued in 22CF6.
Case is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Filed by the State:  INTL set for 02/14 @ 1:30 in Br 2 
   Original IA date/time doesnt work with Marathon Cty where he is being housed
Initial Appearance set for January 24, 2022 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 1

No contact with the address as stated on the record or the residents of that address 
Comply with all open bond conditions

1:56 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Criminal Trespass, Bail Jumping - Felony (6 counts) and Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor (2 counts).
Defendant failed to meet with the public defenders office today and Atty Soule cannot say if he is eligible for public defender representation or not. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 
Court will adopt the $1,500 signature bond with the conditions as stated on the record. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  January 24, 2022  @ 2:15 p.m.  in Branch 1
